title: Psycho-Epistemology

articles.content:
Psycho-epistemology is the study of man’s cognitive processes from the aspect
of the interaction between the conscious mind and the automatic functions of
the subconscious.
articles.attribution:
“The Psycho-Epistemology of Art,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 18

articles.content:
“Psycho-epistemology,” a term coined by Ayn Rand, pertains not to the content
of a man’s ideas, but to his method of awareness, i.e., the method by which his
mind habitually deals with its content.
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff, editor’s footnote to Ayn Rand’s “The Missing Link,”
Philosophy: Who Needs It, 39

articles.content:
The subconscious is an integrating mechanism. Man’s conscious mind observes and
establishes connections among his experiences; the subconscious integrates the
connections and makes them become automatic. For example, the skill of walking
is acquired, after many faltering attempts, by the automatization of countless
connections controlling muscular movements; once he learns to walk, a child
needs no conscious awareness of such problems as posture, balance, length of
step, etc.—the mere decision to walk brings the integrated total into his
control.
articles.attribution:
“The Comprachicos,”
Return of the Primitive: The Anti-Industrial Revolution, 55

articles.content:
Most people know nothing about psycho-epistemology. They take their habitual
method of thought for granted, leaving it unidentified and unquestioned. Yet
this kind of ignorance can be disastrous. . . . Men can automatize wrong methods
of thought without even knowing it. In order to achieve intellectual control,
therefore, in order to enjoy the full power over your mind that volition makes
possible, you must identify your psycho-epistemological methods, and correct
those, if any, which are not consonant with your adult knowledge.
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff,
The Philosophy of Objectivism lecture series, Lecture 6

articles.content:
Men’s epistemology—or, more precisely, their psycho-epistemology, their method
of awareness—is the most fundamental standard by which they can be classified.
Few men are consistent in that respect; most men keep switching from one level
of awareness to another, according to the circumstances or the issues involved,
ranging from moments of full rationality to an almost somnambulistic stupor.
But the battle of human history is fought and determined by those who are
predominantly consistent, those who, for good or evil, are committed to and
motivated by their chosen psycho-epistemology and its corollary view of
existence.
articles.attribution:
“For the New Intellectual,”
For the New Intellectual, 21

articles.content:
While the alleged advocates of reason oppose “system-building” and haggle
apologetically over concrete-bound words or mystically floating abstractions,
its enemies seem to know that integration is the psycho-epistemological key to
reason, that art is man’s psycho-epistemological conditioner, and that if
reason is to be destroyed, it is man’s integrating capacity that has to be
destroyed.

acknowledgement:
“The Psycho-Epistemology of Art,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 18
